repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Py_SIZE() must not be used as an l-value anymore in Python 3.9:
Py_SET_SIZE() must be used instead:

* https://bugs.python.org/issue39573
* https://docs.python.org/dev/c-api/structures.html#c.Py_SET_SIZE

comment_data.body: The thing is, this touches the deallocation machinery, and we're in deallocation code already here. The code pretty intentionally only changes the refcount (to temporarily keep the object alive / resurrect it) for calling into (arbitrary) user defined code, before continuing to clean it up.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1692,9 +1692,9 @@ def generate_usr_dealloc_call(self, scope, code):
         code.putln("{")
         code.putln("PyObject *etype, *eval, *etb;")
         code.putln("PyErr_Fetch(&etype, &eval, &etb);")
-        code.putln("++Py_REFCNT(o);")
+        code.putln("Py_INCREF(o);")
         code.putln("%s(o);" % entry.func_cname)
-        code.putln("--Py_REFCNT(o);")
+        code.putln("Py_DECREF(o);")

comment_data.body:
The prefix is `__Pyx_`, not `_Pyx_`.
Also, the `doâ€¦while` isn't needed since we control the usages on our side.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -829,6 +829,13 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject * __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemStrWithError(PyObject *dict,
   #define PySet_CheckExact(obj)        __Pyx_IS_TYPE(obj, &PySet_Type)
 #endif
 
+
+#if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030900A4
+  #define _Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size) Py_SET_SIZE(obj, size)
+#else
+  #define _Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size) do { Py_SIZE(obj) = (size); } while (0)

comment_data.body: Oh I see, I modified my PR to add __Pyx_SET_REFCNT() function instead.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1692,9 +1692,9 @@ def generate_usr_dealloc_call(self, scope, code):
         code.putln("{")
         code.putln("PyObject *etype, *eval, *etb;")
         code.putln("PyErr_Fetch(&etype, &eval, &etb);")
-        code.putln("++Py_REFCNT(o);")
+        code.putln("Py_INCREF(o);")
         code.putln("%s(o);" % entry.func_cname)
-        code.putln("--Py_REFCNT(o);")
+        code.putln("Py_DECREF(o);")

@@ -829,6 +829,13 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject * __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemStrWithError(PyObject *dict,
   #define PySet_CheckExact(obj)        __Pyx_IS_TYPE(obj, &PySet_Type)
 #endif
 
+
+#if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030900A4
+  #define _Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size) Py_SET_SIZE(obj, size)
+#else
+  #define _Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size) do { Py_SIZE(obj) = (size); } while (0)

comment_data.body:
This test would probably fail after your CPython change, though.
```suggestion
    #define my_SET_SIZE(obj, size)  __Pyx_SET_SIZE((obj), size)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -25,9 +25,9 @@ cdef class C:
 
 cdef extern from "Python.h":
     """
-    #define Py_SET_SIZE(obj, size)  Py_SIZE((obj)) = (size)
+    #define my_SET_SIZE(obj, size)  Py_SIZE((obj)) = (size)

comment_data.body:
Just drop this in one. They are related enough not to bloat C files on user side for them.
```suggestion
#if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030900A4
  #define __Pyx_SET_REFCNT(obj, refcnt)  Py_SET_REFCNT(obj, refcnt)
  #define __Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size)      Py_SET_SIZE(obj, size)
#else
  #define __Pyx_SET_REFCNT(obj, refcnt)  Py_REFCNT(obj) = (refcnt)
  #define __Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size)      Py_SIZE(obj) = (size)
#endif
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -829,6 +829,20 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject * __Pyx_PyDict_GetItemStrWithError(PyObject *dict,
   #define PySet_CheckExact(obj)        __Pyx_IS_TYPE(obj, &PySet_Type)
 #endif
 
+
+#if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030900A4
+  #define __Pyx_SET_REFCNT(obj, refcnt) Py_SET_REFCNT(obj, refcnt)
+#else
+  #define __Pyx_SET_REFCNT(obj, refcnt) Py_REFCNT(obj) = (refcnt)
+#endif
+
+
+#if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030900A4
+  #define __Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size) Py_SET_SIZE(obj, size)
+#else
+  #define __Pyx_SET_SIZE(obj, size) Py_SIZE(obj) = (size)
+#endif

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
        # increase the refcount while we are calling into user code to prevent recursive deallocation
        code.putln("__Pyx_SET_REFCNT(o, Py_REFCNT(o) + 1);")
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1692,9 +1692,9 @@ def generate_usr_dealloc_call(self, scope, code):
         code.putln("{")
         code.putln("PyObject *etype, *eval, *etb;")
         code.putln("PyErr_Fetch(&etype, &eval, &etb);")
-        code.putln("++Py_REFCNT(o);")
+        code.putln("__Pyx_SET_REFCNT(o, Py_REFCNT(o) + 1);")

commit.message:
Add __Pyx_SET_SIZE() function

Add __Pyx_SET_SIZE() function: use Py_SET_SIZE() on Python 3.9.0a4
and newer, or use Py_SIZE() as an l-value on older Python versions.

Py_SIZE() must not be used as an l-value anymore in Python 3.9:
Py_SET_SIZE() must be used instead:

* https://bugs.python.org/issue39573
* https://docs.python.org/dev/c-api/structures.html#c.Py_SET_SIZE

Add __Pyx_SET_REFCNT() function

Add __Pyx_SET_REFCNT() function: use Py_SET_REFCNT() on Python 3.9.0a4
and newer, or use Py_REFCNT() as an l-value on older Python versions.

Py_REFCNT() must not be used as an l-value anymore in Python 3.9:
Py_SET_REFCNT() must be used instead:

* https://bugs.python.org/issue39573
* https://docs.python.org/dev/c-api/structures.html#c.Py_SET_REFCNT

Use it in ModuleNode.generate_usr_dealloc_call():

* Replace ++Py_REFCNT(o) with __Pyx_SET_REFCNT(o, Py_REFCNT(o) + 1)
* Replace --Py_REFCNT(o) with __Pyx_SET_REFCNT(o, Py_REFCNT(o) - 1)

title: Use Py_SET_SIZE() on Python 3.9.0a4 and newer
